div.p: Tony Blair is to step down as Prime Minister and First Lord of the Treasury, and it looks like he'll soon be taking a job as Steward of the Chiltern Hundreds. He'll also apparently moonlight as a Middle East peace envoy -- in other news, outgoing Deputy PM John Prescott will be taking up a position as head of Weight Watchers.
Here are a few Blair links...

li.a: BBC: The Blair Years in Graphs
BBC: How will History Judge Blair?
World Politics Review: Tony Blair's Legacy: The View from Europe's Continental Capitals
Seattle Post-Intelligencer: Blair's Decade Marked with Curious Gifts

div.p: Tomorrow, the Queen is expected to invite Second Lord of the Treasury Gordon Brown to form her next government. Wouldn't it be absolutely hilarious if she didn't?
